snippet: Today’s Republicans are as divided on foreign policy as they’ve ever been, and Mitt Romney is finding it hard to bridge the divisions.
abstract: Op-Ed article by foreign policy expert Brian Katulis contends that Republicans are divided on foreign policy, and that Mitt Romney is finding it hard to bridge the gap; observes that Romney's predicament became evident in his vague foreign policy statements during his speech to the Republican convention.
lead_paragraph: Today’s Republicans are as divided on foreign policy as they’ve ever been, and Mitt Romney is finding it hard to bridge the divisions.

headline.print_headline: Republicans, in Search Of a Foreign Policy
headline.seo: Romney Is Caught Between Neoconservatives and Neo-Isolationists
headline.main: Republicans, in Search of a Foreign Policy
